content: I think chatting with a native is the best advice you can give to a language learner. I had to take a test in German as a foreign language (TestDaF) and couldn’t afford any preparation classes or books. So I spoke to German people and I believe that helped me achieve maximum points possible on this test. Apps, on the other hand, don’t help me much. I installed Duolingo to practice my Norwegian but I keep forgetting the words it throws at me :) I guess, there’s no universal “best way” to learn a language — everyone has to find what works for them. Your article offers many useful options. Thanks for sharing!
